AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT
LBCASE LB Address: No 1, Former Griffin Hotel, now Griffin Centre, including shops, bar and first-floor former Assembly RoomMARKET PLACE (west side)KINGSTONLB Grade: GD2LB Ref: 6/24

description: Creation of internal opening and erection of removable screen (retrospective application)
decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent.Reason: This is required by Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Unless otherwise stated on the approved drawings all new work or work of making good shall be executed in matching materials and shall be detailed to match the existing in colour, profile and/or bonding.Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of the Grade-II Listed Building in accordance with Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the works permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of the Listed Building is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design), DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) and DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
